intro: Hieracium coniops, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring sunny to partially shaded conditions. Its leaves are narrow and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. Hieracium coniops is an annual or biennial herb that plays a role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
